poem:
Title: A Handbag's Chronicle

In the window of dawn, a whisper of chintz,
Stuart dreams of the catwalk's glittering stint.
Yet, beneath this sheen, a plea ignites,
for designers to champion sustainability's fight.
A handbag spun from yesteryear's trends,
holds a future where style and conscience blends,
where Instagram's bustle and fashion week's band,
are mere notes in a sustainable symphony, hand in hand.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Fashion weeks hand". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
